title.narrative: Peace School - Global everyday interdependence and responsibility

description.narrative: The project themes are peace and security Agenda 2030 (goals 5101617) global interdependence and global responsibility. Issues of peace and global interdependence and their relation to development and global justice are approached through concrete examples and on micro-level which enables Finnish children and young people to relate to the reality of developing countries from their own experiences. We want to increase children and young peoples understanding of global development issues causes of the refugee crisis and non-violence as a value and a concrete factor in their life. Our aim is that young people become aware of the consequences and effects of their actions and choices. The project will reinforce young peoples sense of inclusion in society and enco urage them to be active global citizens. The project is based on approach of critical global citizenship education. It will employ experiential and action-based teaching methods in particular methods of participatory drama which evoke thoughts emotions and empathy.Project activities:- Providing teacher students with trainings to support critical global citizenship education with a view to offering abilities and methods to address issues of peace and development at schools- Providing comprehensive school stu dents in the Helsinki metropolitan region Turku Tampere Swedish speaking areas and Vaasa with activity programs on Peace and development. The activity programs support the new national curriculum (OPS 2016) transversal competence (L2 and L7) and phenomenon -based learning and act as an interdisciplinary method-The activity programs will be implemented using dramatized stories (process drama method) in which the project themes are explored through methods of drama. Pedagogic content addressing central themes of this project will be developed around the Peace School dramatized stories developed during the previous project linking them to school curricula-Organizing Peace School facilitators trainings which introduce the instructors to questions of development c ritical global citizenship education teaching methods of participatory drama and the pedagogic content developed in the project.A total of 149 140 euro grant has been given to this two-year project by MoFA.
